title: Add property-based tests with proptest
description: Why: Catch edge cases hand-crafted tests miss. Done when: Proptest generators for Transaction streams, invariant checks: total==available+held, no negative balances, locked accounts reject deposits/withdrawals, idempotency (same input=same output). Stress test with large tx IDs (u32 range).

title: Implement resolve transaction
description: Why: Releases held funds back to available. Done when: Decreases held, increases available, total unchanged. Notes: Verify client matches original tx (reject+log on mismatch). Ignore if tx doesn't exist or not under dispute. Clears disputed state on tx.

title: Implement streaming CSV input parser
description: Why: Must handle large datasets efficiently per spec. Done when: Reads CSV from file path arg, streams records (not load all upfront), handles whitespace in fields, deserializes to Transaction. Notes: Use csv crate with serde, handle optional amount field (dispute/resolve/chargeback don't have it).

title: Implement withdrawal transaction
description: Why: Core transaction type - debits client account. Done when: Decreases available and total by amount if sufficient funds, silently fails otherwise. Notes: Check available >= amount (not total). Reject if account is frozen (full freeze policy). No need to store tx (withdrawals cannot be disputed per spec).

title: Implement CSV output to stdout
description: Why: Required output format per spec. Done when: Outputs client,available,held,total,locked to stdout. Notes: 4 decimal precision, row order doesn't matter, spacing flexible. Use csv crate with serde Serialize.

title: Implement chargeback transaction
description: Why: Final dispute resolution - reverses transaction and freezes account. Done when: Decreases held and total by disputed amount, sets account locked=true. Notes: Verify client matches original tx (reject+log on mismatch). Ignore if tx doesn't exist or not under dispute. Full freeze = all subsequent transactions rejected.

title: Write README documenting assumptions and design
description: Why: Scoring criteria - explain design decisions. Done when: Documents: 1) Only deposits disputable, 2) Client mismatch = reject+log, 3) Full freeze policy, 4) Double dispute = ignore+log, 5) Error handling strategy, 6) Streaming approach for efficiency.

title: Add unit tests and sample test data
description: Why: Correctness criteria - prove handling is correct with explicit scenarios. Done when: Hand-crafted tests for: happy path (deposit/withdraw), insufficient funds, dispute→resolve, dispute→chargeback, client mismatch rejection, frozen account blocks deposits/withdrawals, double dispute ignored. Include sample CSV files in repo.

title: Implement dispute transaction
description: Why: Holds funds for disputed deposit. Done when: Decreases available, increases held, total unchanged. Notes: Only deposits can be disputed. Verify client matches original tx (reject+log on mismatch). Ignore if tx doesn't exist. Ignore+log if already disputed. Works even on frozen accounts (disputes are about past txs).

title: Define core data types (TransactionType, Transaction, Account)
description: Why: Foundation for all processing. Done when: TransactionType enum (deposit/withdrawal/dispute/resolve/chargeback), Transaction struct (CSV row: type, client, tx, amount), Account struct (available, held, total, locked). Notes: client=u16, tx=u32, amount=Decimal (4 decimal places). Use serde for CSV mapping.

title: Implement deposit transaction
description: Why: Core transaction type - credits client account. Done when: Creates client if not exists, increases available and total by amount. Notes: Must store tx for potential future dispute lookup. Reject if account is frozen (full freeze policy).
